citeinfo.title: Manual Counts Table with Geographic Information - Washington Bicycle and Pedestrian Documentation Project

descript.abstract: This feature class includes all manual count records that have been collected as part of the Washington Bicycle and Pedestrian Documentation Project beginning in 2008. All count records represent counts taken over a 2 hour period, either 7-9 am or 4-6 pm, denoted by the Time field for each record. There is one point for each record in the table. The Washington State Documentation Project occurs annually in the early fall. Bicycle and pedestrian usage of specific intersections in cities throughout the State are counted and documented, similar to the National Documentation Project. WSDOT and the Cascade Bicycle Club enlist the support of volunteers and other organizations to benchmark the numbers of people bicycling and walking on trails, bike lanes, sidewalks, and other facilites across the state. For more information on the Washington State Bicycle and pedestrian Documentation Project, please visit http://www.wsdot.wa.gov/bike/Count.htmThe primary purpose of this dataset is for use as a single download in the WSDOT Open Data Portal.
descript.purpose: Count records from the Washington Bicycle and Pedestrian Documentation Project manual count program (2008 - present). Each count is represented as a feature (point) at the location the count was taken.

idinfo.useconst: For Planning use only. The Washington State Department of Transportation shall not be liable for any activity involving these data with regard to lost profits or savings or any other consequential damages; or the fitness for use of the data for a particular purpose; or the installation of the data, its use, or the results obtained.

procstep.procdesc: Added latest year's manual count data.

attr.attrdef: Feature geometry.
Unique ID for each maual count location
Description of manual count location
Additional note about the manual count location
attr.attrdefs: Washington Bicycle and Pedestrian Documentation Project

attr.attrdef: User entered additional note regarding the manual count
A code that represents a concatenation of the State FIPS 55 Code and the City FIPS 55 Code , administered and maintained by ANSI. These codes originate from the 2000 and 2010 US Census.

The common name of a primarily urban political unit having corporate status and usually powers of self-government established by state charter. City Names are stewarded by Washington State's Office of Financial Management.

A code that is a concatenation of State FIPS Place Code and County FIPS Place Code, administered and maintained by the American National Standards Institute for the federal government assigned to a county within Washington State. The code is based on the 2000 and 2010 US Census.
The Name of the County as ratified by County constituents in a general election and approved by the Washington State Legislature.
AM or PM, the period when the count was taken
The calendar year that the count was taken.
The calendar date that the count was taken
Weather code as defined in the National Bicycle and Pedestrian Documentation

edom.edomvd: extreme (heavy rain, snow, freezing, very humid, over 95 degrees)
poor (32-50 degrees, 90-95 degrees, light rain, wind)

attr.attrdef: User entered additional note regarding the weather at time of count

Latitude is a north-south measurement of position on the Earth. It is defined by the angle measured from a horizontal plane located at the Earth's center that is perpendicular to the polar axis. A line connecting all places of the same latitude is termed a parallel. Measurements of latitude range from equator (0) to 90 North and South from this point.

Longitude is a west-east measurement of position on the Earth. It is defined by the angle measured from a vertical plane running through the polar axis and the prime meridian. A line connecting all places of the same longitude is termed a meridian. Measurements of longitude range from prime meridian (0) to 180 West and East from this point.
